newsitem.title: USA: Carnegie Int'l to acquire two companies.
newsitem.headline: Carnegie Int'l to acquire two companies.

text.p: Holding company Carnegie International Corp said on Tuesday that it had negotiated a contract to buy two privately held companies, PTT and Talidan Ltd.

The purchases are in exchange for 19.33 million shares of Carnegie common stock plus warrants for an additional five million shares of common stock over the next 24 months and a $5 million dollar note convertible over three years, Carnegie said in a statement.
Carnegie's president, Lowell Farkas, put the deal's value at roughly $23.5 million, based on today's stock price.
Carnegie also projected consolidated post-tax earnings for Carnegie would come to $1,635,200 in 1997, $5,643,800 in 1998 and $15,064,200 in 1999.
The share exchange will result in Carnegie having 37 million outstanding shares with a current float of 4.5 million shares, the company said.
PTT provides interactive voice response software, while Talidan Ltd is a telecommunications company with its core business in South America and other emerging markets.
